intro.description:
This analysis helps you to detect anomalies in your column dependencies. It determines to which extent the values of a column A determines the values of a column B. This relationship is noted as A->B.
As an example, the value of the “City” column determines the value of the “Country” columns, except in some rare cases.

item.title: Set the analysis metadata.
item.description: This step opens the analysis creation wizard. You can right click on the "Analysis" folder or on a column (or click the link below). This wizard helps you to fill the analysis metadata (name, purpose, description....). At the end it opens an editor in which you can define the settings of the analysis.

item.title: Select the left columns to analyze.
item.description: Click on the "Select columns from A set" hyperlink (or click the link below).

item.title: Select the right columns to analyze.
item.description: Click on the "Select columns from B set" hyperlink (or click the link below).

item.title: Analyze.
item.description: To execute the analysis, click on the "Run" button at the bottom of the editor (or click the link below). You can run the analysis with a context menu on the "Analysis" object in the "DQ Repository" view.
